name: 3dedgedog
author: AFNI Developers
description: Calculate edges in an image using the Difference of Gaussians (DOG) method with extensions/tweaks of the Marr-Hildreth algorithm.

inputs.description: Mask dataset applied after Euclidean Distance Transform calculation
inputs.name: Mask dataset

inputs.description: Calculate mask automatically. Optionally, you can provide an integer X to dilate the initial automask X times (e.g., -automask+X)
inputs.name: Automask

inputs.description: Radius for 'inner' Gaussian, in mm; must be greater than 0 (default: 1.40)
inputs.name: Sigma radius

inputs.description: Define radius for 'inner' Gaussian by providing a multiplicative factor for voxel edge length greater than 0 (default: use sigma_rad)
inputs.name: Sigma number of voxels

inputs.description: Ratio of inner and outer Gaussian sigma values (default: 1.40)
inputs.name: Ratio sigma

inputs.description: Output intermediate datasets: DOG, EDT2, BLURS (default: not output)
inputs.name: Output intermediates flag

inputs.description: Nearest neighbor (NN) value for connectedness of boundaries; must be 1 (face only), 2 (face+edge), or 3 (face+edge+node) (default: 1)
inputs.name: Edge boundary NN

inputs.description: Specify boundary layer to use: NEG, POS, BOTH, BOTH_SIGN (default: NEG)
inputs.name: Edge boundary side

inputs.description: Scale edge values to have relative magnitude between 0 and 100 (default: edge locations have value=1)
inputs.name: Edge boundary scale flag

inputs.description: Calculate edges in 2D per plane specified by SLI: 'axi', 'cor', 'sag'
inputs.name: Only 2D slice

output-files.description: Output Euclidean Distance Transform squared dataset
output-files.name: Output EDT2 dataset
